title: Pathfinders Take Off
description: Pathfinder teams from the 82nd and 101st Airborne Divisions depart England to mark drop zones for the main airborne assault.

title: Pegasus Bridge Captured
description: British glider troops under Major John Howard capture the vital bridges over the Caen Canal and Orne River in a daring coup de main operation.

title: Main Airborne Drops Begin
description: Over 13,000 American paratroopers from the 82nd and 101st Airborne Divisions begin landing across the Cotentin Peninsula.

title: Sainte-Mere-Eglise Liberated
description: The 82nd Airborne Division secures Sainte-Mere-Eglise, making it the first French town to be liberated on D-Day.

title: Naval Bombardment Begins
description: Allied warships begin the massive naval bombardment of German coastal defenses along the Normandy beaches.

title: H-Hour at Utah and Omaha
description: American forces begin landing at Utah and Omaha beaches. Utah goes relatively smoothly while Omaha faces devastating resistance.

title: British and Canadian Landings
description: British forces land at Gold and Sword beaches, while Canadian forces assault Juno Beach, facing rough seas and stiff opposition.

title: Pointe du Hoc Assault
description: U.S. Army Rangers scale the 100-foot cliffs at Pointe du Hoc to destroy German gun positions threatening the beaches.

title: Omaha Beach Secured
description: After hours of brutal fighting and heavy casualties, American forces finally secure the exits from Omaha Beach.

title: End of D-Day
description: By nightfall, Allied forces have established footholds on all five beaches. Approximately 156,000 troops have landed with over 10,000 casualties.

title: Beaches Linked
description: All five invasion beaches are finally connected into one continuous beachhead.

title: Cherbourg Captured
description: American forces capture the vital port city of Cherbourg, though the Germans have demolished harbor facilities.

title: Caen Falls
description: After weeks of bitter fighting, British and Canadian forces finally capture the city of Caen.

title: Operation Cobra Begins
description: American forces launch Operation Cobra, the breakout from Normandy, preceded by massive carpet bombing.

title: Liberation of Paris
description: French and American forces liberate Paris, marking the symbolic end of German occupation of France.
